posts.post_content:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for [Liliana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana) & [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites). Spike sees a [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain) with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.   
  
So many synergies, so little time.  
  
**Block**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Standard**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Extended**: [Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) with [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze)  
**Modern**: [Goryo's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goryo's Vengeance)  
**Legacy**: [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return), [Exhume](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exhume), [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead), [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell)  
**Vintage**: [Oath of Druids](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oath of Druids), [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), [Dance of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dance of the Dead)

posts.post_content: Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence)). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5

Posted By: Enemy_Tricolor (5/10/2012 9:44:02 PM)

posts.post_content:
People that think this basically sums up to 'Whenever this creature deals damage, draw 7 cards' are forgetting a good few advantages of this way: 1) It can be used as soon as Griselbrand is put out even though it doesn't have haste. 2) If you have life to spare, it can be used multiple times. 3) Even if your opponent can stop you dealing damage, they can't stop you drawing the cards.  
This card is unbelievably overpowered and with reanimator decks, you can get it out really quickly.  
  
I came up with a fixed and cheaper version of him:  
Griselbrand, Lord of Shadows 4BBB Flying, lifelink 7/7  
At the beginning of your upkeep, lose 7 life and draw 7 cards. Sacrifice a creature: Gain 1 life and draw a card. Whenever a creature attacks you, it's controller gains 1 life and draws a card.  
  
It's cheaper and it's a lot less unfair but it's still really powerful. It also has the same potential for infinite combos that the original has.  
  
@recurringmemories: And that, is why people don't play legacy. I... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Gris-el-brand. Vol-de-mort. Demon-That-Needs-No-Title/He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named  
Make 7 Horcruxes: Write 7 books.  
[Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lich).   
Lifelink? Seriously? Ookaaay...  
The difference between this guy and Mojo Jojo: Mojo Jojo doesn't know AVADA KEDAVRA.  
Give this guy Undying and Persist. You know you want to.  
  
Edit: So, I am thinking this guy should be called out as EXACTLY a 6/5 stars, no more, no less. He's very, very abusable, but he's not actually bannable in Legacy or restrictable in Vintage. He's banned in Commander but that format's nature was different enough from 60-card Constructed to let him run completely unleashed and amok.  
  
Let's imagine a scale where   
''9/5'' is the Power Nine  
"8/5" is "All that Urza Block bull-shit" and   
"7/5" are "abusable cards that are very tough to answer either on speed or on rules"   
Animate Dead, for example, or a Balance cast by a person that knows what they're doing, tend to be 7/5 cards because in addition to having an utterly blowout effect... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Arachnos (1/20/2013 7:07:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Compare this directly to [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Yawgmoth's Bargain ) and you'll realize that it isn't that much less broken.  
  
It costs {B}{B} more, but nobody gives a shit because they can just cheat it out anyways.  
It can only draw in batches of 7, which, yes, is a significant downside, but it can heal you back, which is a significant upside.  
It can die easier because its a creature, but also it can deal damage because its a creature. Oh, and it has flying, so its especially good at that whole deal damage thing.   
  
It feels to me in a format with Reanimator and Entomb etc... this thing is just as deadly as the bargain.   
  
For the record, I think that although this thing is much more broken, its about 1000000000000000000000000000000000000000 times more fun to play than bargain, both with and against.
